In the run up to the 100th anniversary of the publication of the American painter John McAllister’s   The Watercolor Scene, the Museum of Fine Arts (MFA) in Boston has introduced new programs, including a new exhibition of art and photography from the artist’s 1969–74 period, “On New York,” and the museum’s first online exhibition of work by McAllister’s son and grandson.The exhibition, “On the Intersection of Photography and Painting,” will open on March 8, 2020 and run through May 27, 2020. As part of the new partnership between the museum and MoFA, the McAllisters will hold an exhibition of works by McAllister at the museum in 2021, and the museum will offer a digital version of the exhibition, shown only in the United States, in 2020.
